title: George Ford insists England remained 'incredibly calm' when New Zealand scored their only try of semi-final
text:
England have become the first country to reach a World Cup final after being knocked out in the pool stage last time out. In a host nation where calmness is conspicuous, George Ford spoke after the stunning semi-final win of an extraordinary tranquility when the All Blacks scored a try and were attempting a comeback.

“It was incredibly calm behind the posts,” Ford says of Ardie Savea’s 57th-minute touchdown - the All Blacks’ only try. “I think that was massive for us to be honest. That stage of the game - to give a try away, but again we were thinking - what’s next? We went down the other end and got three points, which is exactly how you want to respond.”

England overcame several demons in ...
description: England have become the first country to reach a World Cup final after being knocked out in the pool stage last time out.
